EAB738ECE03A4ABFA2E379D6FA7B1522.description: Determine if formal or informal speech is appropriate in the context of a given situation

FCA8931E34414FBC8C43CE8A6F981B4F.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate. (See grade 7 Language standards 1 and 3 on page 53 for specific expectations.)

C0D72E83310B46E38170D794D6FDA438.description: Use multimedia components/visual displays in a presentation to emphasize salient points

CFA65BBC7C4B4389AFEDB3A215BFF8B3.description: Determine what multimedia components/visual display options best clarify claims and findings

69D2FB66C1434052898E5A4C7F6BFB46.description: Include multimedia components and visual displays in presentations to clarify claims and findings and emphasize salient points.

924415B3FB3F4EAFA97FBABC5D197B8E.description: Demonstrate appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation

1A7410F93E7748B98F19AD02D57E150A.description: Sequence claims, findings, salient points, pertinent descriptions, facts, details, and examples in a focused, coherent manner

07670AF813544543A30CBF85390AC151.description: Determine salient points and pertinent descriptions, facts, details, and examples

3AACD75A96994C439CEA75461E2FAC37.description: Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent manner with pertinent descriptions, facts, details, and examples; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

53017BAAB8BB4065984446F7F51E589E.description: Evaluate the relevance and sufficiency of the speaker’s evidence

2B0EDC307BA244E99F9D4FD1D721F233.description: Evaluate the soundness of the speaker’s reasoning

9233A8BA010E44118BE83C274A2EE9D8.description: Analyze a speaker’s argument and specific claims

1FDE00D122E14E00A539DF9A2645B728.description: Define and identify a speaker’s sound reasoning, arguments, relevant and sufficient evidence, and claims

021FEAE6C23F4184A6C4F4C9625D48D3.description: Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, evaluating the soundness of the reasoning and the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

95A56432BA034FDD8A3643A8AC11F88F.description: Explain how the ideas clarify the topic, text, and issue studied

5533E831A4A846F88517CDDFC263C8DA.description: Analyze the main ideas and supporting evidence presented in diverse media formats

0762F7961125404C89A2BFC684413C90.description: Analyze the main ideas and supporting details presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) and explain how the ideas clarify a topic, text, or issue under study

983D771009CE42318ED800DE4E39BAA1.description: Evaluate new information posed and form personal opinion or modify one's own point of view

54F97C53E4974FD9AE8EF7E81F3EB0F0.description: Acknowledge new information expressed by others and, when warranted, modify their own views.

B740D1BD52DA49DDB0A208DDB06471C8.description: Respond to questions and comments with relevant details, bringing discussion back on topic as needed

AC7EB0AB58D849668D2C4DA61054B193.description: Pose relevant questions that elicit elaboration

A66D97307D8247A5A3CFF880BD22C0AE.description: Formulate comments, questions, and responses based on evidence and observations and ideas

3F23F7BF11354C8491DE1431B2DB4CBF.description: Pose questions that elicit elaboration and respond to others’ questions and comments with relevant observations and ideas that bring the discussion back on topic as needed.

6DBD2D9D08BA4665993310FF3EF5EF92.description: Demonstrate collegial rules and roles during discussion

BFE3B0B142384FCBA3FF2888F56830D7.description: Track progress toward specific goals and deadlines, defining individual roles as needed

83382658B51F4B838A88D6C948F325A5.description: Explain components of a collegial discussion and planning

EB1A7483B4B24C1EAF6665559651477A.description: Follow rules for collegial discussions, track progress toward specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as needed.

B4214E2235484FA391E54F112136354D.description: Analyze prepared materials to probe and reflect ideas to advance the discussion

3B51F446447F4FEABF1A91E6BF1D2273.description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or researched material under study; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion.

AA052DF00FD546B5A4C93C934FE5BBDB.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacherled) with diverse partners on grade 7 topics, texts, and issues, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

9504197F6CB846D19262AF1ABDB574C2.description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

A2012B19A20E45CD8E9B7AD2469A946E.description: Define the connotations and denotation of words.

936FF2835C0F45D5A66686C1D225F13C.description: Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., refined, respectful, polite, diplomatic, condescending).

4EFBE6E872804E9C9F264A42FE8C4B04.description: Analyze the relationship between particular words

ECC2C116443F43F3BB800EB0FF2DBAE6.description: Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonym/antonym, analogy) to better understand each of the words.

D128BA12CB0843B3926C2ABD8DCEE0D0.description: Interpret figures of speech (e.g., literary, biblical, and mythological allusions) in context.

4A977A85FD2E401A805560B5A4DE0F02.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

1EA475E5BD394167A44AB076AC9D6A87.description: Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

00E3CDDC495E42A5BA917B95C4B32E26.description: Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

196C95679CE748478DBBBB1FEF8987D3.description: Determine/clarify the meaning of words using Greek and Latin affixes and roots

23B98C686316461887F3B2A4F6F771CE.description: Identify common, grade appropriate Greek and Latin roots and affixes

0802A8D315054C828F8D00E6AF73F1E3.description: Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., belligerent, bellicose, rebel).

FA122FD1F71D48F2BAD68E84DD50779F.description: Determine/clarify the meaning of words using context clues

4EB750A6C1844A93842FAEEDAE5C510D.description: Identify context clues that help determine the meaning of words

760ADB950CD94D38862E9212A995CC6D.description: Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

1448B8626E494869BFBB13B50710A4E8.description: Choose from a range of vocabulary strategies to determine a word’s meaning

9057B7A7B47D47BE8F82BEC856675BC7.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 7 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

A63205E863FA4EED80C2DB517073EC25.description: Choose language that expresses ideas precisely and concisely, recognizing and eliminating wordiness and redundancy.

A413D8944B6D49D5A07E6D88CBF8F39E.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

E1A2A30061FE46AA9EB4964E23A9E630.description: Recognize that coordinate adjectives describe the same noun

BC561772E4734CFA9866F44BFABC5289.description: Use a comma to separate coordinate adjectives (e.g., It was a fascinating, enjoyable movie but not He wore an old[,] green shirt).

76009F125E2144489C034EC6D39E7562.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

7D2FA652221D400B8AD318F24DCD2D08.description: Place phrases and clauses within a sentence, recognizing and correcting misplaced and dangling modifiers.

2ADCF68EE6AC4F029110827C7594A14C.description: Distinguish when to combine sentences to signal differing relationships between among ideas

5CF2E69709EC431381987850BA847FF1.description: Identify simple, compound, complex, compound-complex sentences

3519E070F07E47D39443B9F5E3D3F96F.description: Choose among simple, compound, complex, and compound-complex sentences to signal differing relationships among ideas.

997292D82A87457BB8761AD4131FCA1E.description: Identify phrases and clauses and their functions in specific sentences

1BC1DE0627CE48A980C371B16B1F0C6A.description: Explain the function of phrases and clauses in general and their function in specific sentences.

ACC68A6B39AE4444A6C2E00CEA2ADB9F.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

D03CB8DFBE0347559C8574AC502D873E.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and
revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of
discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

238A6505D4084F1FB083D8A58060FF2E.description: Cite textual evidence to analyze explicit text

6D7AF3712B1C4EF4ACF18A45A462EEC7.description: Analyze key ideas and details as evidence of understanding text

0944F671C6834E61B2221B95C52F1FD2.description: Draw evidence from key ideas and details as support for research

14D8417B56324483A6454B36B12B22EB.description:
Apply grade 7 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g. “Trace and evaluate
the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is
sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claims”).

181B0BC4C2D64BF68872EE4195041C7A.description:
Apply grade 7 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Compare and contrast a
fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the
same period as a means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter
history”).

5132E2E19A574039BB2C4291AE3AB585.description:
Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection,
and research.

11A0C15C530D483296B669B084DE8987.description: Quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others avoiding plagiarism

F177A9C8454B45A499BE744CE7B9CC8E.description: Assess the credibility and accuracy of each source

0F9344CBD8AD4BCBB939E52B2969A97E.description: Recognize credibility and accuracy of information

90726B15FBF34A20A734A0AA99C14BC4.description:
Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search
terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or
paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a
standard format for citation.

7BAA055494604D058F53266D58D0361B.description: Implement appropriate inquiry methods to conduct a short research project

BFDF948B5851465780975ED7BE0815B0.description: Generate additional related, focus questions for further research and investigation

BDB195074B00415BA86393528D482E24.description:
Formulate focused questions from sources of information for further research and
investigation

652A167EAAAF4E949229AB0C8766DC37.description: Examine relevant and irrelevant information from sources in order to answer a question

868AD64570F542A7A807F28696F04C7E.description:
Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources
and generating additional related, focused questions for further research and
investigation.

C36AB2A9B13D4F5CB5D79578E31224F3.description: Use technology to interact and collaborate with others

61AA160A3242418F85635BCA4CA92CA6.description: Use technology to link to and cite sources

186ACB2FE21F4572BF58A1568AA90DD3.description: Use technology (Internet) to produce, revise, edit, and publish writing

B03E8B3C4A9246ECBEEE1584453FDEBC.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and link to
and cite sources as well as to interact and collaborate with others, including linking to
and citing sources.

8BBA13EE7440402BA986FAC370793DAE.description: Analyze how well the focus on the purpose and audience have been addressed

F079054809BA4AAEB14C08E291AC180E.description:
With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen
writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach,
focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed. (Editing for
conventions should demonstrate command of Language standards 1–3 up to and
including grade 7.)

FFDF5FB6308E4B3C883E978C926C7A96.description: Integrate suitable idea development strategies, organization, and style

444B2727D493440282F7321424A80894.description: Analyze reasons in writing to identify task, purpose, and audience

3E3F92B5810442A097375399F14332BF.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and
style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for
writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

88016A96DF3F41CDBA096F77A994232B.description:
Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on the narrated experiences
or events.

207973701E3A475D81A4494ECC070B84.description:
Use precise, descriptive, and sensory language to capture the action and to develop
experiences and events

D7BDD4C368394AC2AB34F3CDC2D5EBEC.description:
Identify how writers use precise words/phrases, descriptions, and sensory details to
help readers visualize or sense action

F9E6E197FC77436F8CA6BE26BB0C2C18.description:
Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory
language to capture the action and convey experiences and events.

8C95A6F2995E480792DDE522C1412BD7.description: Use a variety of transitions to move events along and to signal shifts

F14C794C650B40CBB84E8C96BA3C7698.description:
Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and
signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another.

7DE7B2EA2C8F43EDAEF4BF5B6506F2C2.description: Use dialogue, pacing, and description to develop events and characters

9EC2265C30EC4F06989FB4CECA374101.description:
Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop
experiences, events, and/or characters.

1FA1B51F483244C9A6C65292D0D27167.description: Use story elements and techniques to sequence events and engage the reader

B6FE8CB916E746A78816566FD1B5CFA5.description: Identify various points of view in a narrative

27374B1279E745A4B7C6947B8685482C.description:
Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and
introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds
naturally and logically.

F77C18D1FB344CDE951DBA2EE36AEAB9.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective
technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences.

F55316F3F84C4E759F0A971FCDDBA139.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the
information or explanation presented.

24C1C1DB34D34E63835E665CB373A304.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

9156584B2185435392A008D09B51CC87.description:
Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain
the topic.

4BE4AADA198E488CBDBA6E561A76F5E6.description: Integrate transitions to clarify the relationships between ideas and concepts

7BEFD964C39B4DEC9B5358B92E31A8BE.description: Select appropriate transitions to create cohesion and clarify relationships

E2188C1590AF490CB776B85BA8BA512B.description:
Use appropriate transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships
among ideas and concepts.

4059ED04B53D46488176D4A41662DDEC.description:
Integrate relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations and examples into the
topic

248FC353F358439599261BE5B346FBD5.description:
Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or
other information and examples.

F3BF14DE04E8456EB21C34ECB9551954.description: Use formatting, graphics and multimedia to aid comprehension

94C38F90CB124BD88C04B758B2363325.description:
Organize ideas, concepts, and information using, definitions, classifications,
comparison/contrast, and cause/effect

C2642E7BB0DE4A36A6DABB8DDF72FD7E.description: Determine how to organize ideas, concepts, and information

5D081AF191664ADC9A540CB33E42929D.description: Determine when to include graphics or multimedia

44CBCC38322B43FD8AC75EA92D7DB7D2.description:
Determine which strategy is most effective to further develop a topic including
definitions, classifications, comparison/contrast, and cause/effect

EB08ED29B2AB487A8526C4421CF58B3E.description:
Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts,
and information, using strategies such as definition, classification,
comparison/contrast, and cause/ effect; include formatting (e.g., headings),
graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding
comprehension.

D52CAE1D51234DB9AAFC17EBB2170FCC.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts,
and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.

BC0AD9521EDF49D2B15D513E9AB62914.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the
argument presented.

C3ECD406BBB94E13AD2FCCE74BEEE9C0.description: Demonstrate and maintain a formal style

F51D72D3B9F9435994E3F734138455AC.description: Establish and maintain a formal style

A202676290044D5CB679775C54A1A02D.description: Recognize phrases and clauses that create cohesion and clarify relationships

6658AC8C4903465FA75DA2C76E43440B.description:
Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships
among claim(s), reasons, and evidence.

96AFBF4D194B4AD0A4549861D8661479.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the topic or text

AC70F897D6F9488DB02805A113B22D21.description: Evaluate sources for credibility and accuracy

E39CB8A173BD495691410871CAB8A89D.description: Determine logical and relevant support for claims

71F71879DC6E49B48C30B168C1ACB919.description:
Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant evidence, using accurate,
credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

1D97FCC14AF4491398DDA70F0DA26D21.description: Determine how to introduce claims and acknowledge alternate or opposing claims

8A98FC5B15B84D90A2A2131AE27F0DCE.description: Identify and define relevance, evidence, argument, and cohesion

C12F1CDD7EEB45AEB6B3E00BB9FA6964.description: Identify and define alternate and opposing claims

1C902823938B4DE0BBABFF839D79CEF6.description:
Introduce claim(s), acknowledge alternate or opposing claims, and organize the
reasons and evidence logically.

0BCDE136AB824DF78F7F2420BBF3F747.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

927B42EA5ED54D059955DEA34C8DAB2B.description:
Read nonfiction literature in the grades 6-8 text complexity band proficiently with
scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range

397CC1F20EF348AEAD9920057F8D7661.description:
Comprehend nonfiction literature in the grades 6-8 text complexity band proficiently with
scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range

3917C8AAFE5C4EA68D073FB3B63ED9E5.description:
By the end of the year read and comprehend literary nonfiction in the grades 6-8
text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the
range.

0EDDF9F8BB9A45B49F22AA32FE116D16.description:
Read literature in the grades 6-8 text complexity band proficiently with scaffolding as
needed at the high end of the range

396BEED1735A405F850CD413ADCE1AA3.description:
Comprehend literature in the grades 6-8 text complexity band proficiently with
scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range

282C9555C09748F1AFF8D85AA62A6F21.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories,
dramas, and poems, in the grades 6-8 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding
as needed at the high end of the range.

C2AFF58DFCA746F38875081D5FFA7F68.description:
Analyze how texts by different authors present their ideas by advancing different
interpretations of facts in informational text

C026D61DFE5B419A9F0F7F00770B3890.description:
Analyze how texts by different authors present their ideas by emphasizing different
evidence in informational text

725D74160D4942ADB93F03142296908A.description:
Identify key information by different authors advancing different interpretations of facts
in informational text

D2B018CC81154C349D89AFBA97FF332A.description:
Identify key information by different authors emphasizing different evidence in
informational text

E193070FD0F146DCBF4A17132106ED5B.description:
Analyze how two or more authors writing about the same topic shape their
presentations of key information by emphasizing different evidence or advancing
different interpretations of facts.

AE0F766486ED42B1BCB9E174287B979E.description: Evaluate the argument and specific claims in informational text

13A65DC0D52D46A2AD6FE99ACFEC396A.description: Assess the soundness of the reasoning in informational text

3BF09F632D644E1FAE4A99FAAF2983ED.description: Assess the sufficiency of evidence for specific claims in informational text

6511E067DBED4263AEB2A236CCC88A6B.description: Assess the relevance of evidence for specific claims in informational text

F03DD3A1F58D46E1B3D47570B49A4DD0.description: Identify the argument and claims in informational text

14C9318869224DA8A430C7490D38EBD2.description: Identify relevant, sufficient evidence and sound reasoning in informational text

C7D34318021B4F49AB1B6E6096600DED.description:
Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether
the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claims.

B3C5E042F1274280AFCCFE15CA3039F3.description:
Analyze how the audio, video, or multimedia version of various texts portrays the
subject in informational text

6BD878E7C9644BAEABAAD88CC9362F43.description: Compare and contrast various media portrayals of subjects in informational texts

67B71183F7D64DD5BE94DF52CC2E5A92.description: Identify characteristics of audio, video, and multimedia versions in informational text

1B3BF7CB554C4EFF8D5C560C2B4F6A27.description:
Compare and contrast a text to an audio, video, or multimedia vision of the text,
analyzing each medium's portrayal of the subject (e.g., how the delivery of a speech
affects the impact of the words).

5FC1AE5E1CC84AC498937C74317C500C.description: Analyze how authors of fiction use or alter history

4A1765BFBCCC4D22981E56F3CFB0DD7B.description:
Compare/contrast fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character against a historical
account of the same period

C1CACC9038864F0CAA7CB30069E82927.description: Identify a time, place, or character in a fictional work

E4C0B9381DA9497FB7498805EC2C8854.description: Identify a time, place, or character in a historical account

7861365D2C3343048A235BA82C9827B9.description:
Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a
historical account of the same period as a means of understanding how authors of
fiction use or alter history.

973117758B7F4DE59B7FA0B0A1AAD4A6.description:
Compare and contrast what is seen/heard in a text when visually/auditory presented to
what is experienced when reading

EF2716E6456C43A090B2D2106E36863A.description: Analyze the effects of various medium techniques on audio, film, stage, and multimedia

72F27E2990B544D280153D2B87428AEE.description:
Analyze the effects of various medium techniques on written text: stories, dramas, and
poems

755FDAABD6A146F397F0E188C09CECB9.description: Identify various mediums (written forms and audio/visual forms)

98C0AD1B56554AC8B8B0A6E9AEA8A112.description:
Compare and contrast a written story, drama, or poem to its audio audio, filmed,
staged, or multimedia version, analyzing the effects of techniques unique to each
medium (e.g., lighting, sound, color, or camera focus and angles in a film).

1866CE4F6548459C880541964967D401.description:
Analyze how the author distinguishes his/her position from that of others in
informational texts

4B3D6EAA908443FB9C052035206C8095.description:
Distinguish the author’s point of view and those of others mentioned or implied in
informational text

7DBB36711C9E43058DC31C8713292FEF.description: Explain how the author conveys his/her point of view in informational text

F25F0DCA80454F7ABC2268FEF05BB43E.description:
Identify details or examples for developing the point of view or purpose in informational
text

7DAD254A5B2B4E5B9668A0047D4861C7.description: Recognize the author’s point of view or purpose in informational text

0E266C04CE2049B1A7D8A379331EEF9F.description:
Determine an author's point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the
author distinguishes his or her position from that of others.

D81055A960D848FFA14B131660AF3259.description:
Analyze how a chapter/section contributes to or develops the main idea in informational
text

2A64C840F78841958E08887CB270D9D5.description: Analyze how paragraphs contribute to or develop the main idea in informational text

0435DD7B66D74A4298D3251F5BB74ECB.description: Analyze how sentences contribute to or develop the main idea in informational text

9DDC0C251C424E83B98E8DB2ECC7CB12.description:
Recognize how major sections of text contribute to or develop the main idea in
informational text

2F682B065E58472E8383A199EFE91BFC.description:
Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major
sections contribute to the whole and to the development of the ideas.

78204942DD7C45E58641546AF5376F6B.description:
Analyze how meaning and tone are impacted by specific word choice in informational
text

2CBA872EAF1D4AD483CCDDDCC6510A17.description:
Determine the meaning of figurative, connotative, and technical words/phrases in
informational text

65AA50AC089C4EF4B228565B40D75302.description: Identify figurative, connotative, and technical words and phrases in informational text

84AB312D79EF45FFA32D264F09BBE709.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including
figuative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word
choice on meaning and tone.

23A4C6B3B04F4E1B8D23102F575A13C7.description: Analyze how the author contrasts different points of view in a single text

20CFB6A3F16E4FF9AC44C9E70D4B3182.description: Analyze how the author develops points of view of different characters or the narrators

58A583FC5DA941F18EBEE3C8E0DC3B8F.description: Compare/contrast points of view of different characters or narrators

6CC050A5973942A2A443F30AC09C67AC.description:
Identify details or examples where the author develops the point of view of various
characters or narrators

740A38A2A04647E69AA75AC3611B7E70.description:

narrator

Analyze how an author develops and contrast the points of view of different
characters or narrators in a text.

Analyze how the relationship between the poem/drama’s form and structure contributes
to its meaning

00CF0FB3E1E2485A8730E4BE05A40709.description:

figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of rhymes and other repititions

or drama.
